RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 1 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 75. Claiming Purse 12000. (PLUS UP TO $6,000 THRIF) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON A RACE SINCE MAY 4 OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since May 4 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since April 4 Allowed 4 l bs. Claiming Price $6,250, For Each $625 To $5,000 2 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $4,000 Or Less Not Considered In Eligibility). British Columbia Bred Claiming Price $8,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SLEW'S DA BOSS away well and stalked the leaders in the run down the backstretch while racing two out from the rail, commenced his bid three wide through the final turn, collared the pacesetters entering the lane, and inched clear late. BABY GRAND away alertly and raced to the lead from along the rail entering the first turn, set a pressured pace from the inside of DRILLER in the run down the backstretch and through the final turn, was overtaken entering the lane, and battled gamely from along the rail in the drive to hold the place. DRILLER broke sharply and pressed the pace from the outside of BABY GRAND in the run down the backstretch, continued to battle two wide through the final turn, was overtaken entering the lane, and just missed the place while racing one out from the rail in the drive. JUVEE TOO unhurried early while dropping back to trail, eased off the rail and gained a striking position in the run to the final turn, rallied two wide through the turn, and finished from along the rail in the drive while lacking racing room late. YOU DON'T OWN ME stalked the leaders into the backstretch while saving ground at the rail, dropped back to trail in the run to the final turn, and lacked the needed closing response when called upon.

ENTRY.NAME: Baby Grand
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, led rail, rallied inside, closed rail

ENTRY.NAME: Driller
ENTRY.OWNER: Danard Don B and Snow Mel
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, pressed 2 wide, rallied 2 wide, closed 2 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Juvee Too
ENTRY.OWNER: High Stakes Thoroughbreds and Snow John
ENTRY.COMMENT: unhurried early, trailed, rallied 2 wide, closed rail

ENTRY.NAME: You Don't Own Me
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked inside, lacked response

ENTRY.NAME: Slew's Da Boss
ENTRY.OWNER: Snow Mel Corsan Doug and Houweling Len
ENTRY.COMMENT: away well, stalked 3 w, rallied 3 w, led, inched clear

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 2 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 61. Maiden Claiming Purse 12000. (PLUS UP TO $6,000 THRIF) FOR MAIDENS, THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $8,000, For Each $1,000 To $6,000 2 lbs. British Columbia Bred Claiming Price $10,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SELF SERVING dueled for the lead one out from the rail entering the backstretch, took a narrow advantage into the final turn, held a clear lead into the lane, and drew clear late. BORROWED EQUITY tracked the dueling leaders into the backstretch while racing two out from the rail, rallied three wide entering the final turn, and finished willingly two out from the rail in the drive to prove clearly second best. UNION MAN bobbled in the opening strides, but recovered quickly and tracked the leaders in the run down the backstretch while racing just out from the rail, commenced his bid two wide entering the final turn, but was unable to make a late impact. SHOWMAN broke sharply and vied for the lead from along the rail in the run down the backstretch, struggled to keep tabs on his pace rival entering the final turn, and was outfinished over the final furlong. BARBERRY BANDIT away alertly and tracked the leaders two out from the rail from between rivals in the run down the backstretch, rallied two wide entering the final turn, clipped heels midway through the turn, and fell. Barberry Bandit walked off under his own power following the race. The stewards conducted an inquiry into the incident on the final turn following the race. After review there was no change made to the original order of finish.

ENTRY.NAME: Showman
ENTRY.OWNER: Barroby Harold J and Barroby Mrs Harold J
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, vied rail, rallied inside, outfinished

ENTRY.NAME: Self Serving
ENTRY.COMMENT: dueled 2 wide, rallied 2 wide, led, drew off

ENTRY.NAME: Union Man
ENTRY.COMMENT: bobbled start, tracked inside, rallied 2 wide, needed more

ENTRY.NAME: Barberry Bandit
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, tracked 2 wide, rallied 2 wide, clipped heels, fell

ENTRY.NAME: Borrowed Equity
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked 3 wide, rallied 3 wide, closed 3 wide,

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 3 1 1/16M Dirt CR: 86. Allowance Purse 20000. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over Since May 4 Allowed 2 lbs. Such A Race Since April 4 Allowed 4 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: AROLLERCOASTERRIDE away alertly and tracked the leader through the stretch the first time while racing one out from the rail, maintained a tracking trip in the run down the backside, launched his bid three wide entering the final turn, assumed command entering the lane and quickly drew clear as much the best. STORMY BLUE broke sharply and raced to the lead from along the rail entering the first turn, controlled the pace through the stretch the first time, turned back a challenge from BOITANO in the run down the backstretch and into the final turn, was no match when tackled by AROLLERCOASTERRIDE leaving the turn, and while no match for that rival late, continued on gamely three wide in the lane to prove clearly second best. BOITANO away well and stalked the leader through the stretch the first time while racing one out from the rail, moved up through the second turn to force the issue from the outside of STORMY BLUE in the run down the backstretch and into the final turn, was unable to keep pace with the top pair late while finishing from along the inside in the drive to garner a share. EDDIE WHO was off a step slow, but raced into a tracking position from along the rail entering the stretch the first time, maintained his position into the backstretch, rallied along the inside entering the final turn, but was unable to mount a late bid when called upon. PRINCE CAIRO unhurried early while dropping back to trail, saved ground through the final turn, shifted four wide entering the lane, but needed more when called upon.

ENTRY.NAME: Stormy Blue
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, led rail, rallied rail, closed 3 wide, 2nd best

ENTRY.NAME: Eddie Who
ENTRY.COMMENT: step slow, tracked rail, rallied inside, needed more

ENTRY.NAME: Boitano
ENTRY.OWNER: Snow Roger E Danard Don B and Rozenek Conrad
ENTRY.COMMENT: away well, stalked 2 w, pressed 2 w, rallied 2w, closed rail

ENTRY.NAME: Arollercoasterride
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, tracked 2 wide, rallied 3 wide, led, drew clear

ENTRY.NAME: Prince Cairo
ENTRY.COMMENT: unhurried early, trailed, rallied inside, needed more

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 4 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 71. Claiming Purse 12500. (PLUS UP TO $6,250 THRIF) FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since May 4 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since April 4 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $8 ,000, For Each $1,000 To $6,000 2 lbs. BC Bred Claiming $10,000, Three Year Old $12,000 (BC Bred $15,000).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: COCORITA tracked the leader into the first turn while racing one out from the rail, collared the pacesetter two wide entering the final turn, battled through the turn from between rivals and prevailed in the late stages following a stretch long battle. FILLY FATALE away alertly and raced to the lead from along the rail entering the first turn, dictated the pace in the run down the backside, was quickly tackled two wide entering the final turn, was overtaken leaving the turn, but battled willingly from along the rail in the drive to get the place. TOBESUNNY broke sharply and stalked the early pace while saving ground at the rail entering the backstretch, tipped three wide and quickly collared the leaders entering the final turn, and battled willingly three wide in the drive in a solid effort.

ENTRY.NAME: Filly Fatale
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, led rail, rallied inside, closed rail

ENTRY.NAME: Cocorita
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked 2 wide, rallied 2 wide, closed 2 wide, prevailed

ENTRY.NAME: Tobesunny
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, stalked rail, rallied 3 wide, closed 3 wide,

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 5 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 88. Allowance Optional Claiming Purse 20000. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES OR CLAIMING PRICE $12,500. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since May 4 Allowed 2 lbs. April 4 Allowed 4 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: AQUITANIA ARRIVAL away alertly and raced to the lead from along the rail entering he first turn, set a pressured pace from the inside of EARS TO US in the run down the backstretch, sprinted to a clear advantage through the final turn, and continued to widen his advantage late while well in hand. ROOKIE YEAR broke sharply and tracked the leaders in the run down the backstretch, rallied from along the inside entering the final turn, and closed two wide in the stretch drive to prove clearly second best. ITSMYDAY settled well off the early pace while saving ground along the inside, commenced his bid one out from the rail entering the final turn, and finished willingly from along the rail in the drive to get up for a share. EARS TO US away well and chased the pacesetter into the first turn while drifting five wide, pressed the leaders two wide in the run down the backstretch, was unable to match strides with the pacesetter entering the final turn, and was outfinished in the drive. JOCK TALK unhurried early while trailing the field into the backstretch while racing two out from the rail, was always well back and failed to be a factor.

ENTRY.NAME: Aquitania Arrival
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, led rail, rallied inside, drew clear

ENTRY.NAME: Itsmyday
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled inside, rallied 2 wide, closed rail

ENTRY.NAME: Rookie Year
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, tracked rail, rallied inside, closed 2 w, 2nd best

ENTRY.NAME: Jock Talk
ENTRY.COMMENT: unhurried early, trailed, no factor

ENTRY.NAME: Ears to Us
ENTRY.COMMENT: away well, pressed 2w, rallied 2w, outfinished

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 6 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 76. Claiming Purse 11000. (PLUS UP TO $5,500 THRIF) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON A RACE SINCE JANUARY 1 OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since May 3 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since April 4 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $4,000, For Each $500 To $3,000 2 lbs. British Columbia Bred Claiming Price $5,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: FOOT SOLDIER broke sharply and stalked the leader into the backstretch while saving ground at the rail, commenced his bid three wide entering the final turn, and closed two out from the rail in the drive to prevail. KNOPFLER settled off the early pace while saving ground at the rail entering the backstretch, shifted off the rail midway down the backside, rallied smartly three out from the rail entering the final turn, and battled through the lane from the outside of FOOT SOLDIER to just miss. RACING RIVER chased the leaders four wide entering the first turn, tracked the pacesetter three out from the rail in the run down the backside, rallied smartly two wide entering the final turn, held a clear advantage into the lane, but failed to last while finishing at the rail in deep stretch. CALAMAZEUS unhurried early while dropping back to trail, launched a strong three wide bid entering the final turn, and finished with late interest one out from the rail in the drive in a solid effort. I'M A CHI TOO tracked the early pace while racing two out from the rail, rallied two wide entering the final turn, but lacked the needed closing response when called upon. IT'S IN COMMAND away alertly and raced to the lead from along the rail entering the first turn, dictated the pace in the run down the backstretch, was overtaken on the final turn, and weakened in the drive. SIR BARCLAY away well and tracked the leader into the backstretch while racing one out from the rail, began to drop back midway down the backside, and had nothing to offer late.

ENTRY.NAME: Knopfler
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled rail, rallied 4 wide, closed 4 wide, just missed

ENTRY.NAME: It's in Command
ENTRY.OWNER: Barroby Harold J and Barroby Mrs Harold J
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, led rail, rallied inside, weakened late

ENTRY.NAME: Sir Barclay
ENTRY.OWNER: Barroby Harold J and Barroby Mrs Harold J
ENTRY.COMMENT: away well, tracked 2 wide, through early

ENTRY.NAME: Foot Soldier
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, stalked rail, rallied 3w, closed 3w, prevailed

ENTRY.NAME: I'm a Chi Too
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked 3 wide, rallied 2 wide, lacked response

ENTRY.NAME: Calamazeus
ENTRY.COMMENT: unhurried early, trailed, rallied 3 wide, closed 2 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Racing River
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased 4w, tracked 4w, rallied 2w, led, outfinished late

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 7 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 55. Maiden Claiming Purse 11000. (PLUS UP TO $5,500 THRIF) FOR MAIDENS, THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $4,000, For Each $500 To $3,000 2 lbs. British Columbia Bred Claiming Price $5,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SETTEBELLO dueled for the lead from the outside of MILO'S COMMAND entering the backstretch, continued to force the issue from the outside of that rival through the final turn and into the stretch, and got the better of his pace rivals late while inching clear. MILO'S COMMAND away alertly and vied for the lead from along the rail entering the first turn, set a pressured pace in the run down the backstretch and through the final turn, was unable to match strides with his pace rival in deep stretch, and just managed to hold the place. SOMTHING ELUSIVE stalked the early pace while racing one out from the rail entering the backstretch, commenced his bid two wide entering the final turn, and continued four wide in the drive to just miss the place. WELLSLEY broke sharply and tracked the leaders into the backstretch while saving ground at the rail, rallied along the inside entering the final turn, and finished two out from the rail in the drive. DEANARROW settled well off the early pace while racing a bit rank in the early going, rallied four wide entering the final turn, but lacked the needed closing response when called upon. BECKAS BOY unhurried early while trailing the field into the backstretch , saved ground at the rail from the back of the pack entering the final turn, but was only able to pass tired rivals late. BE SPARKY tracked the early pace while racing two out from the rail entering the backstretch, began to weaken entering the final turn, and had nothing left for the drive. THREE DAY BENDER was unprepared at the start while tossing his head prior to the break, began to advance four wide upon entering the backstretch, but weakened over the final furlong.

ENTRY.NAME: Deanarrow
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled 3 wide, rallied 4 wide, needed more

ENTRY.NAME: Three Day Bender
ENTRY.COMMENT: unprepared start, settled 3w, advanced 1/2, weakened late

ENTRY.NAME: Wellsley
ENTRY.OWNER: Tod Mountain Thoroughbreds and Redekop James
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, tracked inside, rallied rail, closed 2 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Beckas Boy
ENTRY.OWNER: Barroby Harold J and Barroby Mrs Harold J
ENTRY.COMMENT: unhurried early, trailed, rallied inside, never menaced

ENTRY.NAME: Settebello
ENTRY.COMMENT: dueled 2w, rallied 2w, closed 2w, inched clear

ENTRY.NAME: Somthing Elusive
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked 2 wide, rallied 2 wide, closed 4 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Milo's Command
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, vied rail, rallied rail, closed rail, held place

ENTRY.NAME: Be Sparky
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked 3 wide, rallied 3 wide, faded
